Weâ€™re excited to announce the **General Availability (GA)** of the redesigned **Data Mapper UX** in the **Azure Logic Apps (Standard)** extension for **Visual Studio Code**. This release marks a major milestone in our journey to modernize and streamline data transformation workflows for integration developer.

### What's new

The new UX, previously available in public preview, is now the **default experience** in the Logic Apps Standard extension.

![]()

This GA release reflects direct feedback from our integration developer community. Weâ€™ve resolved **blockers** that we heard from customers and usability issues that impacted performance and stability, including:

- **Opening V1 maps in V2**: Seamlessly open and edit existing maps you have already created with latest visual capabilities.
- **Load schemas on Mac**: Addressed schema-related crashes on macOS for a smoother experience.
- **Function documentation updates**: Improved guidance and examples for built-in collection functions that apply on repeating nodes.

### Whatâ€™s coming next

Weâ€™re not stopping here. Hereâ€™s a glimpse of whatâ€™s ahead:

- **Smart mapping**: Schema-aware suggestions to accelerate mapping process and reduce manual effort to drag and drop.
- **Select root node**: Choose any node from referenced schemas to be root node.
- **Flat file schema support**: Natively deal with CSV files within Logic Apps to be used for mapping.

### Stay connected

We would love to hear your feedback. [Please use this form link](https://aka.ms/mapper-feedback) to let us know if there are any missing gaps or scenarios that are not yet covered
